Package manito.eft.interfaces

Interface EPSHost

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEPSHost
    public interface EPSHost
    Device access methods for callback to the host POS.

    Most of these operations are blocking. If non-blocking input is needed e.g. for an optional "cancel transaction" button, the caller must implement the multi-threading required to achieve this.

    • Method Detail

      • getPosType

        int getPosType()
        Return the type of POS currently connected to EftLink.

        Returns:
        int - status of printer 
            POS_TYPE_UNKNOWN - unidentified generic POS
        
    POS_TYPE_LUCAS - Lucas
        
    POS_TYPE_RETAIL_POS - RetailPOS (Retail-J)
        
    POS_TYPE_RPBE - RetailPos Business Edition (DRS)
        
    POS_TYPE_OSCAR - Oscar
        
    POS_TYPE_COOP - CO-OP

      • getSession

        EPSSession getSession()
        Return POS attributes/properties for the current session.

        Returns:
        EPSSession - session attributes.

      • getTransactionHistory

        EPSOperation[] getTransactionHistory()
        List of operations (payments, refunds, loyalty etc.) performed so far on the current transaction.

        Returns:
        EPSOperation [] - operations (payments, refunds, loyalty etc.) performed so far on the current transaction.

      • referral

        EPSResult referral​(EPSRequest request,
                   EPSCore requester)
        Refer an EPSRequest to an alternate core.

        The sender still retains control over the overall transaction and is responsible for the final POS response.

        This operation is blocking for the duration of the request, but DeviceAccess calls may be made back into the calling core while the the request is in progress.

        Parameters:
        request - EPSRequest - all data relating to the request.
        requester - EPSCore - core implementation making the request.
        Returns:
        EPSResult - result of the operation with any related data.

      • referral

        @Deprecated
EPSResult referral​(EPSRequest request,
                   EPSCore_1_4 requester)
        Deprecated.
        As of 21.0.0. Marked for removal. Use referral(EPSRequest, EPSCore) and cast as necessary.
        Refer an EPSRequest to an alternate core.

        The sender still retains control over the overall transaction and is responsible for the final POS response.

        This operation is blocking for the duration of the request, but DeviceAccess calls may be made back into the calling core while the the request is in progress.

        Parameters:
        request - EPSRequest - all data relating to the request.
        requester - EPSCore_1_4 - core implementation making the request.
        Returns:
        EPSResult - result of the operation with any related data.

      • deviceAccess

        Generic device access request.

        The call is blocking until the required action has been taken or responded to

        Parameters:
        request - DeviceRequest - request descriptor
        Returns:
        DeviceResponse - response details

      • display

        boolean display​(String text)
        Display on the POS screen.

        The message will remain on-screen indefinitely until overwritten or the end of the payment session.

        This is a non-blocking call, it does not wait for the message to be cleared.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        text - String - Text to be displayed. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        Returns:
        boolean - true when the operation completes, false if it failed.

      • display

        boolean display​(String text,
                boolean acknowledgementRequired)
        Display on the POS screen.

        The acknowledgement option is only for the operator to confirm that the message has been seen, not as a means of selecting an action to be taken.

        If the acknowledgement option is set, the call is blocking until the button is pressed or the operation is cancelled.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        text - String - Text to be displayed. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        acknowledgementRequired - boolean - Flag for whether an 'OK' acknowledgement button is to be shown.
        Returns:
        boolean - true when the operation completes, false if it failed.

      • display

        boolean display​(String text,
                boolean acknowledgementRequired,
                int timeout)
        Display on the POS screen.

        The acknowledgement option is only for the operator to confirm that the message has been seen, not as a means of selecting an action to be taken.

        If the acknowledgement option is set, the call is blocking until the button is pressed or the operation is cancelled.

        Parameters:
        text - String - Text to be displayed. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        acknowledgementRequired - boolean - Flag for whether an 'OK' acknowledgement button is to be shown.
        timeout - int - maximum number of seconds to wait for the response
        Returns:
        boolean - true when the operation completes, false if it failed or timed-out.

      • print

        boolean print​(String text)
        Print to the POS receipt printer.

        This is a blocking call, though completion does not guarantee that the print was successful e.g. if there were a paper jam. Equally, it may only mean the the print request has been spooled for later printing.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        text - String - Text to be displayed. Can include embedded line feeds or use .
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the text was successfully printed or spooled, false if it failed.

      • print

        boolean print​(String[] text)
        Print to the POS receipt printer.

        This is a blocking call, though completion does not guarantee that the print was successful e.g. if there were a paper jam. Equally, it may only mean the the print request has been spooled for later printing.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        text - String array - Lines of text to be displayed.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the text was successfully printed or spooled, false if it failed.

      • getPrinterStatus

        int getPrinterStatus()
        Check status/availability of the printer.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Returns:
        int - status of printer 
            PRINTER_OFFLINE - printer is offline or not available for an undisclosed reason
        
    PRINTER_ONLINE - printer is online and has paper
        
    PRINTER_PAPER_OUT - printer is online but has no paper

      • getPrintWidth

        int getPrintWidth()
        Get the print width.

        Allows formatting of print lines.

        Returns:
        int - number of characters allowed on a print line.

      • getOperatorInput

        String getOperatorInput​(String prompt)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Display on the POS screen and wait for a response from the operator.

        The call is blocking until the operator completes the input request or the operation is cancelled.

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        Returns:
        String - text entered by operator, null if the operation failed, empty string if it was cancelled.

      • getOperatorInput

        String getOperatorInput​(String prompt,
                        int inputType)
        Display on the POS screen and wait for a response from the operator.

        The call is blocking until the operator completes the input request or the operation is cancelled.

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        inputType - int - type of input required 
            INPUT_ALPHA - alphanumeric input with full keyboard
            INPUT_NUMERIC - numeric input using keypad
        Returns:
        String - text entered by operator, null if the operation failed, empty string if it was cancelled.

      • getOperatorInput

        String getOperatorInput​(String prompt,
                        int inputType,
                        int minLength,
                        int maxLength)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Display on the POS screen and wait for a response from the operator.

        Minimum and maximum length are only a guide, and may not necessarily be enforced.

        The call is blocking until the operator completes the input request or the operation is cancelled.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        inputType - int - type of input required 
            INPUT_ALPHA - alphanumeric input with full keyboard
            INPUT_NUMERIC - numeric input using keypad
        minLength - int - minimum length response expected
        maxLength - int - maximum length response expected
        Returns:
        String - text entered by operator, null if the operation failed, empty string if it was cancelled.

      • getOperatorInput

        String getOperatorInput​(String prompt,
                        int inputType,
                        int minLength,
                        int maxLength,
                        int timeout)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Display on the POS screen and wait for a response from the operator.

        Minimum and maximum length are only a guide, and may not necessarily be enforced.

        The call is blocking until the operator completes the input request or the operation is cancelled.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        inputType - int - type of input required 
            INPUT_ALPHA - alphanumeric input with full keyboard
            INPUT_NUMERIC - numeric input using keypad
        minLength - int - minimum length response expected, 0 means no limit
        maxLength - int - maximum length response expected, 0 means no limit
        timeout - int - maximum number of seconds to wait for the response, 0 means no timeout
        Returns:
        String - text entered by operator, null if the operation failed or timed-out, empty string if it was cancelled.

      • getOperatorSelection

        int getOperatorSelection​(String prompt,
                         String[] options)
        Display a lst of options on the POS screen and wait for one to be selected.

        The call is blocking until the operator make the menu selection or the operation is cancelled.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        options - String array - text to be displayed as menu items for the operator to choose from.
        Returns:
        int - 1-based index into the options that the operator selected, 0 if the operation failed or was cancelled.

      • getOperatorSelection

        int getOperatorSelection​(String prompt,
                         String[] options,
                         int timeout)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Display a lst of options on the POS screen and wait for one to be selected.

        The call is blocking until the operator make the menu selection or the operation is cancelled.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        options - String array - text to be displayed as menu items for the operator to choose from.
        timeout - int - maximum number of seconds to wait for the response, 0 means no timeout
        Returns:
        int - 1-based index into the options that the operator selected, 0 if the operation failed or was cancelled or timed-out.

      • getOperatorConfirmation

        int getOperatorConfirmation​(String prompt)
        Display on the POS screen and wait for confirmation from the operator.

        The call is blocking until the operator makes the selection or the operation is cancelled.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        Returns:
        int - 1-yes 2-no, or 0 if the operation failed or was cancelled.

      • getOperatorConfirmation

        int getOperatorConfirmation​(String prompt,
                            String[] options)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Display on the POS screen and wait for confirmation from the operator.

        The call is blocking until the operator makes the selection or the operation is cancelled.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        options - String array - null if the words "yes" and "no" are to be used, otherwise text strings to be used in their place.
        Returns:
        int - 1-yes 2-no, or 0 if the operation failed or was cancelled.

      • getOperatorConfirmation

        int getOperatorConfirmation​(String prompt,
                            String[] options,
                            int timeout)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Display on the POS screen and wait for confirmation from the operator.

        The call is blocking until the operator makes the selection or the operation is cancelled.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Parameters:
        prompt - String - text to be displayed as a question or prompt to the operator. Can include embedded line feeds for multi-line display.
        options - String array - null if the words "yes" and "no" are to be used, otherwise text strings to be used in their place.
        timeout - int - maximum number of seconds to wait for the response, 0 means no timeout
        Returns:
        int - 1-yes 2-no, or 0 if the operation failed or was cancelled or timed-out.

      • getCardSwipe

        EPSResult getCardSwipe()
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Request a card swipe from whatever card reader is available.

        The call is blocking until a card is swiped.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest) or readCard().

        Returns:
        EPSResult - result object with card details if successful

      • getCardSwipe

        EPSResult getCardSwipe​(int timeout)
        Deprecated.
        marked for removal
        Request a card swipe from whatever card reader is available.

        The call is blocking until the card is swiped or the operation times out.

        deprecated - use deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest) or readCard().

        Parameters:
        timeout - int - maximum number of seconds to wait for the response, 0 means no timeout
        Returns:
        EPSResult - result object with card details if successful

      • readCard

        DeviceResponse readCard()
        Request a card swipe from whatever card reader is available.

        The call is blocking until a card is swiped.

        shortcut method - further options are available by using deviceAccess(manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest).

        Returns:
        EPSResult - result object with card details if successful

        DeviceResponse readCheque​(int timeout)

      • reprintLastEftReceipt

        boolean reprintLastEftReceipt​(String addheader,
                              String addFooter)
        Reprint the last eft receipt (if exists) to the POS receipt printer.

        This is a blocking call, though completion does not guarantee that the print was successful e.g. if there were a paper jam. Equally, it may only mean the the print request has been spooled for later printing.

        Parameters:
        addheader - optional header line to add to the stored receipt
        addFooter - optional footer line to add to the stored receipt
        Returns:
        boolean
